author: Special Correspondent
text:
BJP Puducherry unit new president V. Saminathan being greeted by former president and MLA M.Visweswaran. BJP national secretaryH. Raja and Art and Culture wing president, Tamil Nadu unit, Gangai Amaran, look on.— Photo: T. Singaravelou

Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) National Secretary H. Raja on Tuesday appealed to the party cadre to strive hard to bring a substantial number of party MLAs to Puducherry Legislative Assembly in the 2016 Assembly polls which are only a few months away.

He was taking part in a felicitation function organised for the newly-elected BJP Puducherry unit president V. Saminathan who assumed charge on Tuesday. Speaking at the function, the BJP National Secretary recalled various achievements of BJP-led National Democratic Alliance Government at the Centre. He urged the cadre to take the programmes and achievements of the Modi government to people. He also asked them to work hard with the aim of launching a fair number of BJP legislators into the Puducherry Legislative Assembly.

In his acceptance speech, Mr. Saminathan said the people of Union Territory are in anticipation of a radical change through the forthcoming polls. He also wanted them to take pledge to make the party capture more number of seats.

Without naming the ruling AINRC, Mr. Saminathan hinted that some political parties were having second thoughts about an alliance with BJP now. However, the BJP will be a deciding factor in the forthcoming Assembly polls, he said.

BJP Tamil Nadu unit’s Art and Culture wing president Gangai Amaran, Puducherry unit’s former presidents- MLA M. Visweswaran, S.P.K. Damodharan and Keshwalu took part in the felicitation.
title: BJP cadre urged to strive for increasing strength in Assembly
